subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Oakland Raiders lost their case in California’s top court after contending in a lawsuit that the N.F.L. sabotaged the team’s effort to build a stadium at Hollywood Park in Los Angeles. The case dates back more than 20 years when Al Davis, the Raiders’ managing partner, accused the league of purposely not doing enough to help the team move from the antiquated Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum to a new stadium. The Raiders returned to Oakland in 1995 after spending 13 years in Los Angeles. The N.F.L. won a 9-3 verdict in 2001, but a Los Angeles County Superior Court judge ordered a new trial amid accusations that one juror was biased against the team and Davis, and that another juror committed misconduct. A state appeals court overturned that decision, and the California Supreme Court unanimously upheld the ruling.
